The three-way decision process at Google was never depicted as a cozy session of like-minded individuals all on the same page; apparently the trio decided on a more conventional organization chart. We agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, Eric Schmidt wrote.
